page.title: 10Albany Prison.
page.content: Albany Prison is a top security prison and has around 300 inmates at any time. The staffing ratio is about 50-50 taking into account all staff including governor, warders industrial and non-industrial staff. The cost of keeping an inmate is at present Â£12000 a year. The work of the prison is to rehabilitate and to reform. To this end the prisoners do a variety of work which involves the learning of skills such as woodwork,tailoring and wireworking.Some men work in the kitchens, on wing maintenance,a few in the hospital wing and in season on the gardens.For this work they are paid a wage of about Â£3.00 given in the form of credit to be spent at their own shop which sells,food, papers etc..
